comment:
* The AidGroup class represents a group of Application Identifiers (AIDs). * *

The format of AIDs is defined in the ISO/IEC 7816-4 specification. This class * requires the AIDs to be input as a hexadecimal string, with an even amount of * hexadecimal characters, e.g. "F014811481". * * @hide

variables.name: MAX_NUM_AIDS
variables.comment: * The maximum number of AIDs that can be present in any one group.

methods.name: public String getCategory()
methods.comment:
* Returns the category of this group.
     * @return the category of this AID group

methods.name: public List<String> getAids()
methods.comment:
* Returns the list of AIDs in this group.
     *
     * @return the list of AIDs in this group

methods.name: public void dump(@NonNull ProtoOutputStream proto)
methods.comment:
* Dump debugging info as AidGroupProto.
     *
     * If the output belongs to a sub message, the caller is responsible for wrapping this function
     * between {@link ProtoOutputStream#start(long)} and {@link ProtoOutputStream#end(long)}.
     *
     * @param proto the ProtoOutputStream to write to

methods.name: public void writeToParcel(@NonNull Parcel dest, int flags)
public static AidGroup createFromXml(@NonNull XmlPullParser parser) throws XmlPullParserException, IOException
methods.comment:
* Create an instance of AID group from XML file.
     *
     * @param parser input xml parser stream
     * @throws XmlPullParserException If an error occurs parsing the element.
     * @throws IOException If an error occurs reading the element.

methods.name: public void writeAsXml(@NonNull XmlSerializer out) throws IOException
methods.comment:
* Serialize instance of AID group to XML file.
     * @param out XML serializer stream
     * @throws IOException If an error occurs reading the element.

methodNames: public void writeToParcel(@NonNull Parcel dest, int flags)
public static AidGroup createFromXml(@NonNull XmlPullParser parser) throws XmlPullParserException, IOException
public void writeAsXml(@NonNull XmlSerializer out) throws IOException
